description: This Dart source file defines an API client for handling HTTP requests, including error handling, and managing authorization tokens, for a Flutter frontend application. It includes an ApiException class, the ApiClient class with methods for GET and POST requests, and internal helper methods for constructing headers and handling responses.

classes.name: ApiException
classes.description: Custom exception class for API and HTTP errors, carrying an error message and optional status code.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: A basic API client class that manages HTTP requests with support for authorization tokens, request headers, and response handling.

methods.name: ApiClient.create
methods.description: Factory method to instantiate ApiClient with optional authorization token, reading base URL from environment variables.

methods.name: _headers
methods.description: Constructs the request headers, including Content-Type, Accept, and Authorization if token is set.

methods.name: _uri
methods.description: Builds a Uri object by combining the base URL, path, and optional query parameters.

methods.name: _handle
methods.description: Handles the http.Response, decoding JSON on success or throwing an ApiException on failure.

methods.name: post
methods.description: Performs an HTTP POST request with JSON-encoded data and returns the response as a Map.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Performs an HTTP GET request with optional query params and returns the response as a Map.

methods.name: getList
methods.description: Performs an HTTP GET request expecting a list in response.

methods.name: postNoBody
methods.description: Performs an HTTP POST request without a body and returns the response as a Map.
